thoughts.text: We have successfully used the 'execute_shell' command to list the files in the root directory. We can now try to use the 'read_file' command to read the contents of a file in the root directory.
thoughts.reasoning: Since we were able to successfully use the 'execute_shell' command to list the files in the root directory, it is likely that the command is working correctly. We can now try to use the 'read_file' command to read the contents of a file in the root directory and see if it is working correctly.
thoughts.plan: - Use the 'read_file' command with the argument '/etc/os-release' to read the contents of the os-release file in the root directory
thoughts.criticism: I should make sure to select a file that we have permission to access and that is not critical to the system.
